content.2: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.
content.3: And dost thou open thine eyes upon such an one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?
content.6: Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as an hireling, his day.
content.7: For there is hope of a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.
content.8: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground;
content.10: But man dieth, and wasteth away: yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where
content.12: So man lieth down, and riseth not: till the heavens
content.13: O that thou wouldest hide me in the grave, that thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past, that thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!
content.14: If a man die, shall he live
content.15: Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.
content.16: For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?
content.18: And surely the mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of his place.
content.19: The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow
content.20: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.
content.21: His sons come to honour, and he knoweth
content.22: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
